intro: Strychnos axillaris, commonly known as the rock apple or mountain apple, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible when ripe but contain toxic seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems, often found in rocky or arid habitats.
